WCAS First-Year Seminar

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Freshmen/Sophomores Only
topic: African History through Literature and Film

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Uses literary and cinematic works as a window into the history of sub-Saharan Africa. Explores the difficulty of using artistic works as historical sources, and the value of art as both a representation of the past and an artifact of the past. The politics of storytelling and art, and the relationship between cultural and social change. Topics include the impacts of colonialism and globalization, Apartheid South Africa, civil wars, urban culture, and corruption. Students will make short blog posts each week to help seed our discussions and will work on oral presentations. In addition, students will complete a final creative project and will have an opportunity for very brief research into films or novels of their choosing.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Blog posts, an oral presentation, participation in discussion and a final creative project.
